questions.question: What performs calculations?
questions.explanation: CPU executes instructions. Speed: measured GHz (billions/second). Cores: modern have multiple. Heat generation: requires cooling. Clock: synchronizes operations. Essential: every computer has. Performance: primary factor in speed.

questions.question: What stores running programs?
questions.explanation: RAM: fast temporary storage. Volatile: loses data on power-off. Speed: nanoseconds access. Capacity: GB to TB modern. Upgrade: improves performance. DDR: modern standard (DDR4, DDR5). Essential: running programs need RAM.

questions.question: What persists data long-term?
questions.explanation: Storage: permanent data keeping. HDD: mechanical (slower, cheap). SSD: electronic (faster, expensive). Capacity: TB standard. Speed: important for boot, load times. Backups: critical protection. Failure: data loss risk.

questions.question: What provides power?
questions.explanation: PSU: converts AC to DC. Wattage: must handle system needs. Efficiency: reduces waste. Failure: complete shutdown. Quality: affects stability. Upgrade: necessary for power-hungry hardware. Essential: every computer needs.

questions.question: What connects components?
questions.explanation: Motherboard: backbone connecting all. Contains: CPU socket, RAM slots, connectors. Buses: transfer data. Chipset: coordinates components. Expansion: add components. Lifespan: typically system lifespan. Critical: failure = computer dead.

questions.question: What manages heat?
questions.explanation: Cooling: prevents overheating. Types: air (fan), liquid. Importance: heat damages components. Thermal paste: improves contact. Fan: moves air. Efficiency: balance cooling vs noise. Maintenance: dust buildup reduces effectiveness.

questions.question: What transmits signals?
questions.explanation: Cables: connect components. Types: power, data (SATA, PCIe), display (HDMI, DisplayPort). Quality: affects signal integrity. Length: matters for signal strength. Connectors: must match ports. Organization: affects airflow.

questions.question: What houses the system?
questions.explanation: Case: physical container. Purpose: protection, organization. Size: determines component compatibility. Airflow: design affects cooling. Expandability: internal space limits. Aesthetics: appearance matters. Material: typically metal, plastic.

questions.question: What displays output?
questions.explanation: Monitor: visual output device. Resolution: determines clarity. Size: screen diagonal measurement. Refresh rate: higher = smoother. Color accuracy: important for photo/video work. Connections: HDMI, DisplayPort, DVI.

questions.question: What receives audio?
questions.explanation: Speakers: convert electrical signals to sound. Quality: depends on driver, design. Wattage: power output. Frequency response: audio range coverage. Placement: affects sound quality. Connections: typically 3.5mm or USB.
